B8E8171622E246518E003E5E8A52310E.description:
differentiate between common baking methods and identify common ingredients used in

describe the methods of cooking, including dry heat, moist heat, and combination heat;

86E4C367DAAC4C84BA4DD7430DC12DFC.description: The student understands factors that affect the food service industry. The student is expected to:

5C60DC698D6D4AA4B224368E6EF9C325.description: use different types of payment options to facilitate customer payments for services; and

analyze customer comments to formulate improvements in services and products and

1C9A5F07D4FF449D991AE68CECCEE633.description:

FCA00B7DD5844CE1A85425E186A6D7C9.description:
research the local and regional labor workforce market to determine opportunities for

416920D84F4A4EEA94EBF375C443301F.description: demonstrate skills related to seeking employment in the food service industry;

B09C20A5EE274A15BC61B245B7A7F0E3.description:
identify and evaluate the effects of exercise, nutritional dietary habits, and emotional

3A82AABA9C3442F8AD8029A070FCF790.description:

93986A682D51437AB39A7EE6A1177696.description: demonstrate a proactive understanding of self-responsibility and self-management;

C92B9DC15A1D4B629B026523C40B9F8B.description:

B6F3B1568342402C8E9C3DD6AABECF3D.description:

7C237B1F98384F3B88731C2781389D74.description:

2CC5D148821E43C8888B1AAC41E5ADF1.description:

C49438D32BDE4472A7F096176F47600E.description:
determine leadership and teamwork qualities to aid in creating a pleasant working
atmosphere; and

3136E838B7574075AC8CED5AECBB0637.description:

organizational goals and objectives. The student is expected to:

08F7B9113382451E9B74372F7C90A26A.description:
prepare for a state or national food sanitation certification or other appropriate

AE699C7B778B4291A738D426A92407F3.description: determine professional attire and personal hygiene for restaurant employees; and

4FC4D95581FE46B5B98D8AB954CBA7BF.description: research sources of food-borne illness and determine ways to prevent them;

E9282DB8C1CA47C7B0FCA6C312F4E6B8.description: analyze potential effects caused by common chemicals and hazardous materials;

2D256FD82105402D9AC71436A27C9B5C.description:
The student understands the importance of health, safety, and environmental management systems

3099AE8DE7A3497F93142549E9D244E5.description: explain the different types and functions of kitchen, front-of-the-house, and support roles;

78C687564FAD49AA8CC621D519B23CD0.description:

72DCF0853B6A4B56B3FBED9E38DDA241.description: demonstrate knowledge and use of point-of-sale systems; and

6F96C53DDC764414804AA51130C48D07.description:

0A66680724554BAC8AA652D2BC607FF9.description: generate creative ideas to solve problems by brainstorming possible solutions; and

70F7CFCA6AD745DDBA3E054DCAC76321.description:
The student solves problems using critical thinking, innovation, and creativity independently and

6B5A1B997DAD4D838C2FAEC2C99B12B2.description: demonstrate active listening skills to obtain and clarify information

2613B294D6EE4798A6ECDFD4D0E0C5BB.description: demonstrate proper techniques for answering restaurant phones;

A292A3D421934BBB9B582B58935D0471.description:

7EF7B764B9F4474F957417E1A6717A8B.description:
compose a variety of written documents such as menus, presentations, and

A505DFDC888D4A4EA20649EB6BCB2FD1.description: demonstrate self-respect and respect for others;

7EE99F4DB576422D9BA72D8E16099F6E.description: practice professional grooming and hygiene standards;

8AE193B0F2B24ECA91169980FC28ECDE.description: model effective oral and written communication;

D59786C58413434391A834A4E2B67744.description:
The student demonstrates professional standards/employability skills as required by business and
industry. The student is expected to:

4711DBA68BD141C59B59E3FC4AB42227.description:
Statements that contain the word "including" reference content that must be mastered, while those
containing the phrase "such as" are intended as possible illustrative examples.

0D78EC8A0CAD4BE78762B7544449A4C0.description:
Students are encouraged to participate in extended learning experiences such as career and
technical student organizations and other leadership or extracurricular organizations.

DEFD0AEA6F9D4A26975641B518A4BC87.description:
Introduction to Culinary Arts will emphasize the principles of planning, organizing, staffing,
directing, and controlling the management of a variety of food service operations. The course will
provide insight into the operation of a well-run restaurant. Introduction to Culinary Arts will
provide insight into food production skills, various levels of industry management, and hospitality
skills. This is an entry level course for students interested in pursuing a career in the food service
industry. This course is offered as a classroom and laboratory-based course.

E2F2DAD702474B4C932877C6EAB69579.description:
The Hospitality and Tourism Career Cluster focuses on the management, marketing, and
operations of restaurants and other food/beverage services, lodging, attractions, recreation events,
and travel-related services.

E3D0736B3BFE41C78B950BC5AA1118E6.description:
Career and technical education instruction provides content aligned with challenging academic
standards and relevant technical knowledge and skills for students to further their education and
succeed in current or emerging professions.

0CD442E1CE1445619713F0258495C6DA.description:
General requirements. This course is recommended for students in Grades 9 and 10. Recommended
prerequisite: Principles of Hospitality and Tourism. Students shall be awarded one credit for successful
completion of this course.
